SEARCH
Package MODE

Class Grid

java.lang.Object
MODE.Grid
public class Grid extends Object
Represents the grid environment for pathfinding, defined by its dimensions, obstacles, and special cost zones. This class manages the grid's properties and provides methods to query its state, such as checking for obstacles, determining movement costs, and finding valid adjacent moves.

  • Field Details

    • n

      private int n
      The number of rows in the grid (n).

    • m

      private int m
      The number of columns in the grid (m).

    • obstacles

      private Set<Coordenadas> obstacles
      A set of Coordenadas representing points on the grid that are obstacles. Movement through an obstacle is not permitted.

    • costZones

      private List<Special_Cost_Zone> costZones
      A list of Special_Cost_Zone objects, each defining an area where movement edges have a cost higher than the default.

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid(int n, int m)
      Constructs a new Grid with the specified dimensions. Initializes the grid with no obstacles and no special cost zones.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of rows in the grid. Must be a positive integer.
      m - The number of columns in the grid. Must be a positive integer.

  • Method Details

    • getN

      public int getN()
      Returns the number of rows (n) in the grid.
      Returns:
      The number of rows.

    • getM

      public int getM()
      Returns the number of columns (m) in the grid.
      Returns:
      The number of columns.

    • addObstacle

      public void addObstacle(Coordenadas c)
      Adds an obstacle to the grid at the specified coordinates. Once a coordinate is marked as an obstacle, movement through it is disallowed.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordenadas of the point to be marked as an obstacle.

    • addSpecialCostZone

      public void addSpecialCostZone(Special_Cost_Zone zone)
      Adds a special cost zone to the grid. Edges within or crossing these zones may have a higher movement cost.
      Parameters:
      zone - The Special_Cost_Zone to add to the grid.

    • isObstacle

      public boolean isObstacle(Coordenadas c)
      Checks if the given coordinates represent an obstacle on the grid.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordenadas to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates point to an obstacle, false otherwise.

    • custoCaminho

      public int custoCaminho(Coordenadas from, Coordenadas to)
      Returns the cost of moving between two adjacent coordinates. If the movement path (edge) is within or crosses a special cost zone, the highest cost defined by any overlapping special cost zone is returned. Otherwise, the default cost of 1 is returned.
      Parameters:
      from - The starting Coordenadas of the movement.
      to - The ending Coordenadas of the movement.
      Returns:
      The cost of traversing the edge between 'from' and 'to'.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the 'from' and 'to' coordinates are not adjacent.

    • getMaxCustoAresta

      public int getMaxCustoAresta()
      Returns the maximum edge cost present in any of the special cost zones defined on the grid. If no special cost zones exist, the default edge cost of 1 is returned.
      Returns:
      The highest cost of any special cost zone edge.

    • getValidMoves

      public List<Coordenadas> getValidMoves(Coordenadas atual)
      Returns a list of all valid adjacent Coordenadas from a given current coordinate. A move is considered valid if it remains within the grid boundaries and does not lead to an obstacle.
      Parameters:
      atual - The current Coordenadas from which to find valid moves.
      Returns:
      A List of Coordenadas representing all accessible and non-obstacle adjacent points.

    • estaDentro

      private boolean estaDentro(Coordenadas c)
      Checks if a given coordinate is within the boundaries of this grid. Coordinates are 1-indexed (from 1 to n/m).
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordenadas to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are within the grid, false otherwise.

    • saoAdjacentes

      private boolean saoAdjacentes(Coordenadas a, Coordenadas b)
      Checks if two coordinates are directly adjacent (i.e., horizontally or vertically) and not the same point. Adjacency is defined by a Manhattan distance of 1.
      Parameters:
      a - The first Coordenadas.
      b - The second Coordenadas.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are adjacent, false otherwise.
